profile.name: JONATHAN SSEMAKULA
profile.title: AI & ROBOTICS ENGINEER
profile.about: Jonathan is a dedicated Mechatronics and Robotics engineer currently pursuing a Master of Engineering at Universiti Teknologi Malaysia. He holds a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science from Makerere University and has a wealth of experience in autonomous robotics, control systems engineering, computer vision, and machine learning. Jonathan has worked on various robotics and IoT projects, bringing innovative solutions to real-world challenges.

projects.title: Agrisonic
projects.description: Agrisonic is a portable, cost-effective soil testing and crop recommendation device designed to help farmers improve their crop yields by providing real-time data on key soil parameters.
projects.problem: Ugandan farmers face challenges in maintaining consistent crop quality due to poor soil management practices. Soil testing labs are expensive and difficult to access for rural farmers, and many farmers lack the knowledge to interpret soil test results.
projects.solution: Agrisonic offers a user-friendly, affordable soil testing device that measures soil pH, moisture, temperature, and nutrient levels (NPK). It provides real-time data and tailored crop recommendations via a smartphone app, helping farmers make informed decisions to improve soil health and crop quality.
projects.marketOpportunity: With over 7.7 million agricultural households in Uganda and increasing smartphone penetration, Agrisonic has a large potential market. It addresses the gap in affordable soil management solutions for smallholder and commercial farmers, providing a comprehensive tool for precision agriculture.
projects.businessModel: Agrisonic operates on a direct sales model, offering devices through local agricultural supply stores and online platforms. Additionally, a subscription model for advanced features and services, such as continuous crop health monitoring, will be introduced.
projects.fundingRequest: Seeking funding to expand production capabilities, enhance product features, and support marketing efforts to reach smallholder farmers across Uganda and neighboring countries.
projects.futureProspects: Future plans include scaling to other regions in Uganda and East Africa, adding features such as weather prediction and water management, and exploring partnerships with government programs and agricultural cooperatives to improve product accessibility.
projects.team: Led by Jonathan Ssemakula, with a multidisciplinary team of agronomists, engineers, and software developers focused on developing and scaling the Agrisonic solution.

projects.title: EcoSpin
projects.description: EcoSpin is dedicated to transforming plastic waste into high-quality recycled yarn and artificial wool, providing an alternative raw material for the textile industry while minimizing environmental impact.
projects.problem: Uganda generates 600 tonnes of plastic waste daily, with only 6% being recycled. This plastic pollution presents a severe threat to the environment and a missed opportunity for sustainable raw material sourcing in the textile industry.
projects.solution: EcoSpin diverts plastic waste from landfills by recycling it into sustainable, cost-effective yarn and artificial wool for the textile industry. The process is designed to minimize carbon emissions and contribute to a circular economy.
projects.marketOpportunity: With the global recycled plastics market projected to grow to $120 billion by 2030, and the East African recycled plastics market expected to reach $1.2 billion by 2025, EcoSpin is well-positioned to capture a significant share of this market. Additionally, there is unmet demand for recycled textiles in Africa, estimated at $13 million.
projects.businessModel: EcoSpin operates on both B2B and B2C models. It supplies eco-friendly yarn to textile manufacturers and sells directly to consumers through physical and online stores. Revenue is generated from product sales, long-term supply contracts, and partnerships with distributors.
projects.fundingRequest: Seeking $50,000 in seed funding to establish a recycling facility, cover initial production costs, launch collection and marketing initiatives, and support R&D efforts.
projects.futureProspects: EcoSpin plans to scale operations, divert over 100 tons of plastic monthly, and expand to neighboring markets. The company will also launch eco-friendly wool alternatives and continue advancing sustainability in the textile industry.
projects.team: Led by Jonathan Ssemakula as CEO, the team includes experts in mechatronics, data science, and environmental sustainability. Advisors include environmental consultants and business leaders with experience in climate change and agricultural sustainability.

education.qualification: Master of Engineering (M.Eng) in Mechatronics and Robotics
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science

workExperience.description: Provided technical expertise in strategic planning, implementation, and monitoring of projects, with a focus on the Livelihood and Environment sector. Supervised multiple projects, managed business-to-business mobile application development, tracked progress, and ensured projects were delivered on time and within budget. Additionally, coordinated presentations, managed project documentation, and assisted with onboarding and training new staff.

Coordinated consultancy activities, designed digital data collection tools, trained enumerators, and analyzed data using ODK, SPSS, STATA, Python, and R. Developed dashboards using Power BI, Tableau, and D3.js for data visualization and reporting. Supported ICT systems and provided training and technical assistance to users, ensuring accurate data collection and secure storage.

Developed the AdEMNEA project website to enhance project tracking and information sharing. Successfully managed over 95% of the site's development, contributing to the project's visibility and recruitment efforts.

Designed data collection tools and trained research assistants in digital data collection using KoboCollect and ODK. Collaborated with designers to create clean user interfaces, developed public and internal applications, and modified back-end server code. Managed large-scale design projects and contributed to front-end and back-end development tasks for corporate clients.

consultancyAssignments.roleAndAssignment: Modeling and Data Scientist for climate and energy auditing in public buildings in Kasese Municipality. Developed an energy and climate policy.
consultancyAssignments.referencePerson: Evelyn Mugume, Environmental Officer, Kasese Municipality

consultancyAssignments.roleAndAssignment: Lead Consultant under Prophet Research Company for the End of Project Evaluation of the EU-funded DINU project.
Data Scientist responsible for updating the District State of Environment Report for Napak District and developing an Environment Action Plan.
Coordinator and Data Scientist under Voyage Technologies Ltd, assessing access to energy at household and institutional levels in the Greater Kampala Metropolitan Area.
consultancyAssignments.referencePerson: Mugisha Abubaker, M&E, GIS Specialist, WWF

consultancyAssignments.roleAndAssignment: Tech Expert. Developed a food tracking system and dashboard for households impacted by the crude oil pipeline extension.
consultancyAssignments.referencePerson: John Niwamanya, Executive Director, Living Earth

consultancyAssignments.roleAndAssignment: Data Scientist under KENRO Consult Ltd. Developed an Urban Forest Management Action Plan and land use mapping for Kasese Municipality.
Data Scientist. End of project evaluation of nutrition intervention in Palorinya Refugee Settlement.
Data Scientist. Baseline study for the LCF tree planting project in the Rwenzori Region.
Data Scientist under Asante Mama. Conducted baseline study on cocoa production and end-market analysis of the cocoa value chain in the Katonga Catchment, Central Cattle Corridor.
Data Scientist. Feasibility study for productive use of electricity and developed a unique energy model for a mini-grid project in Yumbe.

projectsWorkedOn.name: Autonomous Navigation Robot
projectsWorkedOn.description: Developed a robot implementing various navigation behaviors like voting, priority-based, and action-based systems. Gained proficiency in ROS, SLAM, and robot kinematics.

projectsWorkedOn.name: AdEMNEA Project Website
projectsWorkedOn.description: Designed and developed the website for the AdEMNEA project at WIMEA-ICT, enhancing project tracking and information sharing.

projectsWorkedOn.name: UBS Lexie Investment App and Website
projectsWorkedOn.description: Developed an application and website for managing investor records using Flutter and Firebase. The system facilitates management of investment records for Lexietech Solutions.

projectsWorkedOn.name: CampusFood App
projectsWorkedOn.description: Developed a mobile application for campus students to order food and have it delivered on campus, using Flutter and Firebase.

projectsWorkedOn.name: TSS App and Website
projectsWorkedOn.description: Built a system for tracking food distribution to people displaced by the crude oil pipeline system for Living Earth Uganda, enhancing transparency and accountability in food aid distribution.

ongoingProjects.name: Robot Bag for the Deaf
ongoingProjects.description: An IoT system that converts speech to sign language and displays it on a screen to ease communication for the deaf. This project aims to bridge the communication gap between the deaf community and non-sign language users.

ongoingProjects.name: EthoEnergies: Clean Energy Cooking through Digital Ethanol Stoves
ongoingProjects.description: Developing an improved stove that uses ethanol as fuel, which is environmentally friendly and locally produced from agricultural waste. The project promotes sustainable energy use and reduces reliance on non-renewable resources.

ongoingProjects.name: Agrisonic Farmers’ Aid
ongoingProjects.description: An IoT device that provides real-time soil analysis and crop recommendations using machine learning. It helps farmers optimize crop choices by monitoring soil conditions like pH, moisture, and nutrient levels, with feedback delivered via a smartphone app.

ongoingProjects.name: Smart Baby Bag
ongoingProjects.description: A digitalized bag that monitors a baby’s health conditions such as blood pressure, heart rate, and temperature in real time. This innovation aims to enhance infant safety and provide peace of mind to parents.

ongoingProjects.name: EcoSpin
ongoingProjects.description: A project focused on transforming plastic waste into high-quality recycled yarn and artificial wool. EcoSpin uses energy-efficient processes to minimize carbon emissions and provide sustainable raw materials for the textile industry.

ongoingProjects.name: BOSS1 – Autonomous Delivery Robot
ongoingProjects.description: An autonomous delivery robot targeting supermarkets and restaurants to reduce labor costs and save time. Equipped with sensors and machine learning algorithms, BOSS1 can navigate safely and deliver goods within indoor environments.

ongoingProjects.name: VirtuScope – VR Prototyping Platform
ongoingProjects.description: A research project using Virtual Reality for embedded systems and robotics prototyping. It allows developers to design, simulate, and test robotic systems interactively in a virtual environment, reducing development time and costs.

ongoingProjects.name: ParkEase – Automated Parking Access Control System
ongoingProjects.description: A web-based application that uses facial recognition and car plate recognition to automate parking access control. The system enhances security and efficiency by managing entry and exit processes in parking facilities.
